metadata.title: CVE-2019-20445 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
HttpObjectDecoder.java in Netty before 4.1.44 allows a Content-Length header to be accompanied by a second Content-Length header, or by a Transfer-Encoding header. It was discovered that Netty has HTTP request smuggling vulnerability. A remote attacker could use it to extract sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-20445` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnetty-java - 1:4.1.45-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:4.1.45-1').
